content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Find a recipe for a vegan smoothie bowl on Allrecipes that includes bananas and leaves, has more than 20 reviews, and a rating of at least 4 stars. Provide a list of ingredients, preparation time, and a summary of the recipe steps.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open search to look for vegan smoothie bowl.
Action: Click [589]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Search for vegan smoothie bowl bananas.
Action: Type [29]; vegan smoothie bowl bananas
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to expand the search input.
Action: Click [589]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Search bar textbox [29] is focused; input search query "vegan smoothie bowl".
Action: Type [29]; vegan smoothie bowl
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try typing search query into the other textbox [28] inside the header search widget.
Action: Type [28]; vegan smoothie bowl
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to activate search field by clicking the 'Click to search' button [604].
Action: Click [604]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Click search icon button [604] to open proper input.
Action: Click [604]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search overlay appears active; textbox [29] is present and is the correct input field. Type query now.
Action: Type [29]; vegan smoothie bowl
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to focus the search field before typing so it becomes an actual textbox.
Action: Click [29]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try using header search field (button 850) to activate the input.  
Action: Click [850]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Access Google search page to find suitable Allrecipes recipe quickly since site search is difficult.
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search Google with targeted query for Allrecipes vegan smoothie bowl banana spinach.
Action: Type [1]; allrecipes vegan smoothie bowl banana spinach recipe
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Google search hit a CAPTCHA page; abandon Google route and return to Allrecipes to use its own search.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use Google home search box combobox [1] to query "allrecipes vegan smoothie bowl" again which may not trigger CAPTCHA.
Action: Type [1]; allrecipes vegan smoothie bowl
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Leave CAPTCHA page and return to previous page (Google home), then continue back to Allrecipes.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to previous page in history, likely Allrecipes site.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open Allrecipes search overlay by clicking search button in header to search for vegan smoothie bowl.
Action: Click [498]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search bar textbox [8] is focused and ready; enter search query for vegan smoothie bowl banana.
Action: Type [8]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open the search bar overlay again to access an actual textbox.
Action: Click [498]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Textbox [8] is now focused; enter search query.
Action: Type [8]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the search overlay again to access the real textbox.
Action: Click [498]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search overlay is open; textbox [8] is active. Enter query for vegan smoothie bowl with banana.
Action: Type [8]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reopen search overlay to get the detailed search textbox tree.
Action: Click [498]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Textbox [8] is active; enter search query to find relevant recipes.
Action: Type [8]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to reopen search overlay to access the true input element, then identify correct textbox (likely [7]) instead of the div-like [8].
Action: Click [498]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The overlay search textbox [8] is now active and genuine; enter query to find recipes.
Action: Type [8]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The inline header search textbox [7] may accept typing; focus it then enter query.
Action: Click [7]
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: Try directly typing search text into header search textbox [7] to initiate query.
Action: Type [7]; vegan smoothie bowl banana
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: Navigate to Allrecipes homepage first, where the search function may work more reliably.
Action: Click [470]

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
